data.title: BULWER'S NOVELS FIFTEEN VOLUMES
data.meta_description: Boston: Aldine Book Publishing Co., 1834 . Octavos, Fifteen Volumes. In Very Good minus condition. Spines are gold with red and brown strips and gilt lettering. data.text:
Boston: Aldine Book Publishing Co., [1834]. Octavos, Fifteen Volumes. In Very Good minus condition. Spines are gold with red and brown strips and gilt lettering. Head edges are gilt. Boards have some shelf wear, minor rubbing, and bumping to corners. Volume XI's spine has minor water staining. Text blocks have minor foxing throughout and previous owner's name inscribed on front end paper. Volume I's "The Disowned half-title page and pages 1-3 are uncut. Volume V pages 371-373 are uncut with a small tear on page 373. Volume VIII "Godolphin" pages xix-1 are uncut. Volume XI's title page has a minor stain and "Alice or the Mysteries" pages 73-76 and 81-84 are cut shorter. Volume XII's Rienzi volume two's pages 259-261 are uncut. Volume XIII's "My Novel Vol. I." page 406 is uncut. NOTE: Shelved in Room A.

CONTENTS: Vol. I. "The Last Days of Pompeii; Disowned" (xiii, 233, 482 pages) -- Vol. II. "A Strange Story; Zanoni" (x, 499, xix, 424 pages) -- Vol. III. "The Last of the Barons" (xxiv, 347, 371 pages) -- Vol. IV. "The Parisians" (vii, 357, 350 pages) -- Vol. V. "Night and Morning; Leila Or, The Siege of Granada" (xiv, 528, ix, 373 pages) -- Vol. VI. "The Caxtons; Zicci; The Haunted and the Haunters or The House and the Brain" (vi, 358, 327 pages) -- Vol. VII. "Devereux; Lucretia" (xx, 473, xiv, 450 pages) -- Vol. VIII. "Kenelm Chillingly; Godolphin" (545, xix, 333 pages) -- Vol. IX. "What Will He Do With It?" (482, 446 pages) -- Vol. X. "Pelham; Eugene Aram" (481, xxx, 452 pages) -- Vol. XI. "Ernest Maltravers; Alice or The Mysteries" (x, 407, 446 pages) -- Vol. XII. "Rienzi; The Pilgrims of the Rhine: The Coming Race" (xxi, vi, 247, 261, 392 pages) -- Vol. XIII. "My Novel Vol. I." (406, 464 pages) -- Vol. XIV. "My Novel Vol. II" (413, 501 pages) -- Vol. XV. "Harold: The Last of the Saxon Kings; Falkland Calderon, the Courtier" (xxi, 356, 356 pages).

1373799

Special Collections
